scenario:
S&P Global (SPGI) and American Express (AXP) are highlighted as secure dividend-paying stocks that can provide passive income for decades. 

S&P Global is a dominant player in the credit ratings industry with high barriers to entry, generating a recurring revenue stream. It has a 52-year history of paying and raising its dividend, with a 0.78% yield at the current price. The company's revenue increased 14% year over year in the 2024 fourth quarter, and net income climbed 52%. Earnings per share were $12.35, and the operating margin is 35%.

American Express is a well-established and profitable company with a growing business and strong profitability. It has a 36-year history of paying a dividend and has a 1.3% yield at the current price. The company's revenue increased 8% year over year in the 2024 fourth quarter, and earnings per share were up 16%. American Express has a unique closed-loop system and a strong brand, driving growth across its business.

Both companies have a strong track record of paying and raising their dividends, making them attractive options for investors seeking passive income.
